avalancheActivity.comment: Over a wide area up to 50 cm of snow has fallen above approximately 1900 m. The strong wind has transported a lot of snow. In the last three days large surface-area wind slabs formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines. The fresh wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant at elevated altitudes. At high altitude and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes. Over a wide area new snow is lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. As a consequence of a sometimes strong wind, easily released wind slabs formed. Gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 1700 m.

avalancheActivity.comment: In some regions 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 1700 m. At high altitude and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. The fresh wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant at elevated altitudes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. The new snow of the last three days can be released easily.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes. As a consequence of a sometimes strong wind, easily released wind slabs formed. Gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 1700 m. In particular at low altitude a little snow is lying.
